issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify inheritance rules/reasons for workflow attributes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Documentation enhancement needed to clarify .NET SDK workflow inheritance rules, specifically explaining why [Workflow] attributes and [WorkflowRun] methods aren't inherited from parent classes, while signals/queries can be inherited if properly attributed.

issues.title: [Bug] Signals that can't be deserialized should be dropped/ignored
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Signals with args that can't be deserialized should be dropped/ignored in the .NET SDK, consistent with Go and Java implementations.

issues.title: Change ID to Id
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Fix improper capitalization of 'ID' to 'Id' in the .NET SDK before beta release. This is a naming convention correction to follow proper C# capitalization standards.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Confirm .NET Framework properly copies binaries as expected
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add .NET Framework compatibility testing by creating a smoke test project to verify that the NuGet package properly copies native DLLs when used with .NET Framework, as currently only .NET 6+ is tested.

issues.title: [dotnet] Workflow update support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request for workflow update support in the .NET SDK. This is a blocking feature that depends on core SDK functionality being implemented.

issues.title: Worker versioning support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request for implementing worker versioning support in the .NET SDK to enable gradual rollouts and version compatibility management.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Random with larger seed
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to support larger random seeds in the .NET SDK using SeedableRng's seed_from_u64 method. This would be a breaking change to the existing random implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Disallow workflow attributes on anything static
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add validation to disallow workflow attributes (WorkflowRun, WorkflowSignal, WorkflowQuery) on static methods or classes, preventing incorrect usage patterns in the .NET SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Re-investigate signals/queries/activities as properties
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Re-investigate supporting signals, queries, and updates as properties using expression trees. Initially deferred due to delegate requirements, but modern expression support may enable this pattern.

issues.title: [Bug] If a child workflow is in progress when the service goes down, no workflows are resumed
issues.author: tgrieger-sf
issues.summary: User reported that when a child workflow is in progress and the application crashes, restarting the application does not resume the workflows as expected. The issue was resolved by properly configuring activity timeouts and implementing heartbeating.

issues.title: [Bug] Time skipping test server not auto skipping time properly in some cases
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Time-skipping test server is not properly advancing simulated time when using long timers and DelayAsync calls in workflows, causing tests to sleep real time instead of skipping to the next event.

issues.title: [Bug] https://dotnet.temporal.io/api not loading TOC
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The .NET API documentation site fails to load table of contents (TOC) when accessed at https://dotnet.temporal.io/api without a trailing slash. A Vercel configuration setting is needed to handle trailing slash consistency.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add RPC metadata updater to client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add RPC metadata updater capability to the .NET client, allowing headers to be updated on existing client/connection instances to affect worker operations, similar to other Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Question] Action Dependency Injection
issues.author: m-wild
issues.summary: User asks how to perform dependency injection with scoped services in the .NET SDK, particularly for Activity instances. The SDK doesn't manage Activity instance creation, requiring manual DI handling in user code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update docfx for API docs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update docfx tooling for .NET SDK API documentation to ensure records are properly displayed in the generated API docs.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow that completes with no actions times out with deadlock error
issues.author: cgillum
issues.summary: Workflows that complete immediately with no async operations deadlock with a timeout error. A simple delay resolves the issue, suggesting a problem with how the SDK handles empty or synchronous workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] Local time skipping test server throws `Event set unexpectedly empty`
issues.author: plaisted
issues.summary: Test server with time skipping throws 'Event set unexpectedly empty' when calling GetResultAsync(), and DelayAsync() waits real time instead of skipping time as expected.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Change Ref approach to expression-based
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to modernize the .NET SDK's activity and workflow reference approach by replacing the current Ref pattern with LINQ expression-based syntax, similar to Hangfire. This includes abstracting activity definitions to support dependency injection and modernizing registration of activities and workflows through type-based registration and expression trees.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Activity delegates can sometimes have System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Closure first param
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity delegates created via expression trees may have a System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Closure as the first parameter, which should be excluded from parameter detection. The issue proposes using GetType().GetMethod("Invoke") or adding explicit invoke metadata to ActivityDefinition.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OpenTelemetry support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement OpenTelemetry support for distributed tracing in the .NET SDK via an interceptor-based approach. The feature requires careful handling of span context propagation across service boundaries and resolution of activity context restoration challenges in .NET's distributed tracing model.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cloud test that runs in CI using org secrets
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement a cloud smoke test in CI that uses organization secrets to verify the .NET SDK works against Temporal Cloud.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Simple benchmarker that runs nightly
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement a simple benchmarking tool for the .NET SDK that runs nightly to monitor performance across different scenarios, similar to the existing Python SDK benchmarker.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Replace Go kitchen sink workflow in tests with .NET one
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Replace the Go kitchen sink workflow used in .NET SDK tests with a native .NET implementation, as the .NET SDK is now feature-complete and no longer needs to rely on Go code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Move from Temporalite to Temporal CLI in local testing environment
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Move the .NET SDK testing infrastructure from Temporalite (deprecated) to the newer Temporal CLI for local testing. Includes unskipping a previously disabled workflow patch test once the CLI supports necessary features.

issues.title: When you planning to Release your product
issues.author: P9avel
issues.summary: User inquires about the timeline for .NET SDK GA release, wanting to use Temporal in production with their C# development team.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Temporalio.Extensions.DependencyInjection or similar
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a dependency injection extension for the .NET SDK to make it easy to create and inject lazy clients, similar to npgsql and grpc-dotnet implementations.

issues.title: Using dependency injection in a "worker" project hangs
issues.author: jakejscott
issues.summary: Worker application hangs when ITemporalClient is injected via dependency injection instead of being instantiated directly. Creating the client outside the DI container appears to cause blocking behavior.

issues.title: Trying to start a workflow from asp.net and the client hangs
issues.author: jakejscott
issues.summary: ASP.NET client created at startup hangs when calling StartWorkflowAsync from an endpoint, while creating the client inside the endpoint lambda works fine. The issue was caused by socket/connection polling problems in Tonic that were resolved in upstream dependencies.

issues.title: [Bug] Unable to load shared library 'temporal_sdk_bridge' issue  on docker(linux)
issues.author: mahdiAkhi
issues.summary: Unable to load the native 'temporal_sdk_bridge' library on Linux Docker environments, while it works fine on Windows. The DLL file is missing or not accessible in the deployment, preventing the SDK from initializing.

issues.title: [Bug] DataConverter should not eagerly instantiate payload/failure converter from type
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: DataConverter.Default with PayloadConverterType property assignment fails because the converter is eagerly instantiated before the property can be set. The lazy instantiation pattern should be used instead to allow proper initialization.

issues.title: [Feature Request] what is the roadmap for this sdk,  really need it
issues.author: charzhao
issues.summary: User inquires about the .NET SDK development roadmap. The SDK team clarifies that the workflow portion is under active development with an expected release within weeks, and directs users to the proposals repository for detailed information.

issues.title: [Bug] NuGet package is built with too-new of a glibc version
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: NuGet package is built with glibc 2.32 from ubuntu-latest, which is incompatible with older Linux distributions like Debian 11 that only have glibc 2.31. The build process needs to use an older glibc version to ensure broader compatibility.

issues.title: [Bug] samples-dotnet can not finish job.
issues.author: charzhao
issues.summary: User unable to run .NET samples as jobs remain in running status indefinitely, unlike the Go helloworld example which completes successfully.

issues.title: How to debug sdk?
issues.author: charzhao
issues.summary: User encountered build failures when trying to build the .NET SDK due to missing recursive git clone of sdk-core and missing C++ build tools. After resolving these dependencies, compilation errors in the Rust bridge code appeared, which were resolved by using the correct sdk-core version.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add CancellationToken parameter to TemporalClient.ConnectAsync and friends
issues.author: cgillum
issues.summary: Feature request to add CancellationToken parameter to TemporalClient.ConnectAsync() and related connection methods, following .NET standard practice for I/O operations. The maintainer indicates this requires Rust integration work that hasn't been completed yet.

issues.title: Add API to count workflows
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to add an API to count workflows in the .NET SDK. This is a feature request referenced from a parent issue with more details.

issues.title: go.temporal.io/sdk-v1.20.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A transitive dependency vulnerability (CVE-2022-41723) in golang.org/x/net v0.4.0 was reported via Mend, causing excessive CPU consumption in HTTP/2 HPACK decoder. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support dynamic workflows, activities, signals, and queries
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to support dynamic workflows, activities, signals, and queries in the .NET SDK as part of a broader Temporal feature initiative. This involves enabling runtime definition and registration of these core components rather than requiring compile-time declaration.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-api-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A transitive dependency vulnerability (WS-2023-0366) in rustix-0.38.8 affecting temporal-sdk-core-api-0.1.0 can cause memory explosion in the Dir iterator on Linux. The issue was automatically closed by Mend when the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Specify activity names at runtime
issues.author: cgillum
issues.summary: User needs to specify activity names at runtime rather than compile-time via attributes. Requests an overload for TemporalWorkerOptions.AddActivity(string name, Delegate del) to support dynamic activity naming.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Schedules API
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement a Schedules API for the .NET SDK to match functionality available in other Temporal SDKs. This feature request tracks the need to add support for scheduling workflows.

issues.title: Temporal CLI based ephemeral server
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to opt out of version check for ephemeral Temporal servers started by the SDK test framework, since these servers lack UI and cannot display upgrade notifications. The issue was closed as a duplicate of #50.

issues.title: martincostello.logging.xunit.0.3.0.nupkg: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency security vulnerabilities in martincostello.logging.xunit.0.3.0 package used in tests: two transitive vulnerabilities in System.Text.RegularExpressions (CVE-2019-0820, CVSS 7.5) and System.Net.Http (CVE-2018-8292, CVSS 5.3).

issues.title: microsoft.extensions.logging.abstractions.1.1.1.nupkg: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A transitive dependency vulnerability (CVE-2018-8292) in System.Net.Http 4.3.0 exposed through microsoft.extensions.logging.abstractions allows information disclosure through authentication exposure in HTTP redirects. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: xunit.console.2.4.2.nupkg: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in system.text.regularexpressions 4.3.0 (CVE-2019-0820) causing a denial of service via RegEx string processing. The vulnerable library was a transitive dependency of xunit.console test framework.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Incorporate StyleCop analyzers in CI/format
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to incorporate StyleCop analyzers in CI to enforce consistent code style, specifically ensuring class member order follows StyleCop guidelines (SA1201).

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency security vulnerability in temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0: webpki-0.22.0 has CVE-2018-16875 (CVSS 5.5) allowing CPU denial of service attacks through pathological X.509 certificate chain verification. Issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: tokio-1.23.0.crate: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two vulnerabilities detected in tokio 1.23.0 dependency: a high-severity soundness issue in ReadHalf::unsplit that can violate Pin contracts (CVSS 9.8), and a medium-severity Windows named pipe security issue where pipe_mode resets reject_remote_clients to false (CVSS 5.4).

issues.title: microsoft.testplatform.testhost.17.1.0.nupkg: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency newtonsoft.json 9.0.1 has a high-severity vulnerability (CVE WS-2022-0161) that could cause DoS through stack overflow exploitation. The issue was auto-closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: xunit.2.4.1.nupkg: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security vulnerability in transitive dependency system.net.http.4.3.0 (CVE-2018-8292) exposed through xunit test framework, allowing information disclosure in HTTP redirects. Issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from inventory.
